Also if you kill every fight on turn 1 you dont need to nickel and dime the statuses

embeds.title: Makeshift Battery
embeds.description:
Boss Relic / All / Downfall

Gain :colorless_energy: and add a Slimed into your discard pile at the start of your turn.
*It's an 8.9 volt.*

messages.content:
This card is an excellent tool to mitigate the curses of act 4. It's unlikely that you would draw more than 1 curse per hand anyways if you already have a  35+ card deck, and exhausting it and drawing a fresh card completely negates the issues with curses getting shuffled in by enemies. It is probably one of the best tools in the game to get around that particular snag in the late game gauntlet, and is an incredibly useful effect to strengthen the quality of your turns.

Even before act 4, this card is effective against tri-sentries, slimes, defect 1, ironclad 1, the chosen, tri-slavers, orb walker, repulsors, nemesis, and hermit 3. Defect 1 and ironclad 1 are probably the biggest reasons you might add this card to your deck in the early game. If you don't face one of those two, then you really aren't looking to add this card until very late in the run. Facing hermit in any act (thus assuring that neow will be powered up by it in act 4) can also be a reason to grab a repulsor early, as it will be even more effective than usual. 

With all that being said, there is a significant downside to this card. It's really expensive and usually won't do anything the turn you play it (you could draw a status or curse afterwards, but it's unlikely). Much as you might want one for the late game, taking it too early can be punishing, as it will be bad in the majority of fights leading up to act 4. It does work nicely with some of the "bug" themed status synergies, though some of those cards don't necessarily want you to exhaust the statuses. If you have a mummified hand, then you can also take this more freely earlier in the run. If your run is going extremely well or you have very strong frontloading, then you may be able to get away with taking this early on. There is however no denying that the best time to find it is just before fighting the act 3 boss, and that it will be a curse for most of the run. I do however believe that it is so good later, that it is worth that risk.
I feel like the upgrade on cleanse should let you choose the status to exhaust, would make for a good synergy with turbo
As it is I don't think I ever picked cleanse, I feel like you have to have a really good reason to pick a non encodable attack on auto and there's rarely any to pick cleanse

Back to repulsor, it's an amazing card on auto simply because of its synergy with it's a feature, you get all of the IaF benefits with none of the card draw cost which usually means you get to play more cards per turn which in turn multiples the benefits IaF provides

It's the most reliable way of dealing with statuses that ensures you don't get a hand of 5 dazes or 5 Neow curses whereas bug barrage with be of little use if you draw a turn before or after the statuses.

Refractor on the other hand doesn't trigger it's a feature but instead gets multiplicative dex scaling so ideally you at the start of the turn you would draw couple of statuses, let repulsor deal with them, get refractor info your hand, play it, exhaust more statuses in your draw pile and get a whole lot of block
<refractor>

and this is a mostly strictly better version
So probably should test it more before coming to a conclusion

embeds.title: It's a Feature
embeds.description:
Uncommon Power / 1 :energy_auto: / The Automaton / Downfall

 (**Innate**.)
Whenever you draw a **Curse** or **Status** card, gain 1 temporary :p_temp: **Strength** :p_strength: and **Dexterity** :p_dexterity:.

messages.content: Yeah
lets say you draw 3 statuses, play bug barrage+ , then the 5 drawn cards, 2 of them are statuses
I definitely should try bug barrage since I always pick it's a feature
so you get +5 draw and 50 dmg and +2 extra temp dex and strengh
for 1 cost

that is a dubious opinion at best lol
let's say the baseline is a strike. Then the "upgraded" version is strike+10
Turns out 36 damage for 1 cost is pretty playable even if 6 damage for 1 cost isn't
Being pretty much the entirety of your damage in status builds on your own plus letting you play more cards by cycling the statuses is pretty good
ok I think I am convinced already
lmao

It's like "average defect gameplay but you constantly have 15 strength on top of all the card draw"
I didn't get the perfect opener to turn 1 the boss but I did turn 1 a few act 3 elites
Damn this shouldn't be allowed

The thing is you must draw statuses and BB at the same time, you are more than likely to either:
>get bug barrage with 0-1 statuses in hand, play it and get the status cards that you've wanted as the cards BB draws
>get some status cards into your hand before drawing BB with no way of drawing into it
With repulsor that's not an issue since it doesn't really on having right combination of cards in hand
Doesn't change the fact that BB is a broken card and gets better with every copy of it that you add into your deck but there's room for both BB and repulsor in auto's card pool
Both can shine especially since repulsor is the best way of dealing with curses

So far the status based decks I played killed all of the fights really quickly (encode spam with breaks is a bit slower than barrage spam but still quite fast) so repulsor didnt feel as needed
definitely can help if you play curses and/or probably higher ascensions

just draw ascender‚Äôs bane first or in the same hand 5head
then repulsor still curse
